item.title: Monte Carlo simulation of Buffon's Needle
item.description: authors: Arthur York, Cory Simon Buffon’s Needle is a famous probability problem emanating from the 18th century. setup Imagine a floor marked with an infinite number of parallel, equidistant lines, a width $\ell$ apart. We now toss a needle of length $L<\ell$ onto the floor, where it lands at a uniform random position and with a uniform random orientation. Buffon’s needle problem is to determine the probability that the needle intersects one of the lines on the floor.
